alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 2:41PM MST until July 14 at 4:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR AREAS NEAR KIRKLAND AND WILHOIT...... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Kirkland and Wilhoit in Yavapai County. * WHEN...Until 545 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 239 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Skull Valley Wash, Tonto Wash, Copper Basin Wash, Woolsey Wash, Granite Creek, Kirkland Creek, Orofino Wash, Miller Creek, Iron Springs Wash, Waterman Creek, Willow Creek, Butte Creek, Poplar Wash, Finch Wash, Cottonwood Creek, Board Creek, Hassayampa River, Logan Wash, Bland Creek and Sheppard Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Skull Valley, Kirkland and Wilhoit. - This includes the following highways... State Route 89 between mile markers 285 and 297...and between mile markers 299 and 306.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Low water crossings and areas in hilly terrain will likely experience minor flooding.
